news.title: Robert Levin, founder of freenode[1] and PDPC, passes away

body.p: Early in the morning of September 16th, Rob Levin passed away in the neuro trauma intensive care unit of a Houston hospital after being struck by a car whilst out riding his bicycle. During his long career fostering collaboration within the open source community, Rob did much good work; he is most known for being the driving force behind the freenode IRC network, where many large and popular projects coordinate development activities. Rob was a friend of Gentoo and was always helpful when approached.
We would like to extend our condolences to the family of Mr. Levin, to the freenode staffers, and to PDPC board members. Rest in peace.
